page.title: 18Ecology in Trefriw & Maenan
page.content: Habitats range from marshy fields often flooded by the Conwy, through steeply sloping woodland, to high, bare,rocky moorland, thus supporting a variety of wild life. The climate is mild, sheltered by the mountains to the north west, but with above average rainfall. Fauna includes toad, frog, adder, grass snake,slow worm,mole, shrew, weasel, stoat, fox, badger, rabbit and grey squirrel. Birds include buzzards, sparrowhawks, kestrels, owls, woodpeckers, tree creepers,jays, magpies,pigeons,collar doves, goldcrests,spotted fly-catchers tits,finches and most common birds. Herons and other water birds are found near the river, whilst jackdaws are common near houses,ousting the ubiquitous starlings of towns. Ravens occur in the hills.
